# Day 530

You know what my favorite drug of choice is? Comedy, hands down and it is not even close.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*Cz5wTuOLqZ55OATbba6ZRQ.png)

The ability to make people laugh is a rare and precious gift. It is the ability to cut through tension and awkwardness with a well-timed joke, or to find the humor in even the most difficult situations.

There is a reason why the Joker is one of the most popular villains in pop culture. He is a master of comedy, using his wit and humor to disarm his enemies and get what he wants. But the Joker's comedy is not just about making people laugh. It is also about exposing the dark side of human nature, and the absurdity of the world we live in.

Comedy comes from a place of truth. It is the ability to see the world for what it is, and to find the humor in even the most difficult things. It is a way of coping with pain and suffering, and of making the world a more bearable place. That is why there will always be value in finding the humor in even the most awful of events. Naturally timing and delivery are key, but the right quip at the right time can be a salve for the soul.

Laughter is a beautiful thing. It is a physical manifestation of joy, and it has the power to connect people and make them feel less alone. The world needs more laughter, and more people who are willing to use their humor to make a difference.

As we enter a world which is becoming more and more dominated by screens I want to remind others shitposting is an art. It might not seem like a serious thing, but I know for a fact that the quality shitposters out there have made my life better. I see you. I appreciate you ðŸ«¡
